question.text:
Match the following organisms with their respective structures used for reproduction and choose the correct option.
 
Organism Reproductive structures
i. Green thallophyte a. Gemmules
ii. Organism used to produce the first antibiotic b. Conidia
iii. Animals having a cellular level of organization c. Buds
iv. A freshwater cnidarian d. Zoospore

options.text: i - c , ii - d, iii - a, iv - b
i - d, ii - a, iii - b, iv - c
i - b, ii - c, iii - d, iv - a
i - d, ii -b, iii - a, iv - c

solution.text: Algae are green thallophytes. They reproduce by forming zoospores. Penicillium is the organism used to produce the first antibiotic. It reproduces by forming conidia. Hydra is the freshwater Cnidarian. It reproduces by buds. Sponges are animals with the cellular level of organization. They reproduce by gemmules. These are asexual reproductive structures. The organisms form these reproductive structures which grow into new organisms and detach from the parents or sometimes remain attached to the parents. They are genetically similar to their parents.
